articles.author: Arathy Somasekhar
articles.description: Oil prices ticked up on Thursday, as markets worried about a supply shortage after Saudi Arabia and Russia extended their voluntary supply cuts to the end of the year.
articles.title: Oil prices edge higher on supply woes as Saudi, Russia extend output cuts

articles.author: Kane Wu
articles.description: Asia stocks fell on Wednesday after weak economic data in China and Europe heightened concerns over global growth, while the dollar firmed as investors weighed the outlook for U.S. interest rates.
articles.title: Asia stocks fall as global growth concerns mount

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. auto safety regulators said Tuesday that 52 million air bag inflators produced by auto suppliers ARC Automotive and Delphi Automotive need to be recalled because they may rupture and send dangerous metal fragments flying.
articles.title: US says 52 mln air bag inflators should be recalled over rupture threat

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) has signed a new deal with Arm for chip technology that "extends beyond 2040," according to Arm's initial public offering documents filed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Apple inks new long-term deal with Arm for chip technology - filing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chevron (CVX.N) and a union alliance will hold a final round of talks on Wednesday ahead of planned strike actions at two major liquefied natural gas (LNG) facilities in Australia as ongoing disputes over pay and conditions remained unresolved.
articles.title: Chevron, unions in final talks ahead of planned Australia LNG strikes

articles.author: Arunima Kumar, David French
articles.description: Enbridge (ENB.TO) will buy three utilities from Dominion Energy (D.N) for $14 billion including debt, the Canadian pipeline operator said on Tuesday, creating North America's largest natural gas provider and doubling its gas distribution business.
articles.title: Enbridge bets big on US gas with $14 billion bid for Dominion utilities

articles.author: Manya Saini, Echo Wang, Anirban Sen
articles.description: SoftBank Group's (9984.T) Arm Holdings Ltd launched the roadshow for its blockbuster initial public offering (IPO) on Tuesday as the chip designer tries to convince investors it is worth as much as $52 billion in this year's biggest share sale.
articles.title: SoftBank's Arm launches IPO courting T Rowe in $52 bln valuation ask

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A former chairman of the right-wing Proud Boys group was sentenced on Tuesday to 22 years in prison for his role in the Jan. 6, 2021, assault on the U.S. Capitol by supporters of Donald Trump trying to overturn the former president's election defeat.
articles.title: Ex-Proud Boys leader sentenced to 22 years for role in US Capitol attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a missile attack on Kyiv early on Wednesday, with the country's air defence systems shooting down all missiles before they reached their targets, the capital's military administration said on the Telegram messaging app.
articles.title: Russia launches missile attack on Kyiv - Ukraine's military

articles.author: David Kirton, Max Cherney
articles.description: Huawei Technologies' breakthrough in making an advanced chip underscores China's determination and capacity for fighting back against U.S. sanctions, but the efforts are likely very costly and could prompt Washington to tighten curbs, analysts said.
articles.title: Huawei's new chip breakthrough likely to trigger closer US scrutiny, analysts say
